p: Fe is very important for human nutrition, because of its role in the formation of haemoglobin. Fe concentrations in the analysed samples fell within the range of values already reported, ranging between 7.8 [ 38] and 140 mg kg âˆ’1 [ 1]. In contrast, we detected lower amounts of Mn and Zn, other important enzyme co-factors, compared to other authors [ 1, 37].
